com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget

Class SmartLinearLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget.SmartLinearLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>

    public class SmartLinearLayout
extends android.widget.LinearLayout
implements SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
    An extension of its parent View class, which offers the SmartViewExtension features.
    Since:
    2012.03.06
    Author:
    Édouard Mercier
    See Also:
    SmartRelativeLayout, SmartFrameLayout, SmartImageView

    • Method Detail

      • getRatio

        public final float getRatio()
        Specified by:
        getRatio in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Returns:
        the vertical/horizontal ratio ; when set to 0, no ratio is applied SmartViewExtension.setRatio(float)
        See Also:
        SmartViewExtension.setRatio(float)

      • setRatio

        public final void setRatio(float ratio)
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        Sets the ratio between the width and the height of the image. The default value is 9 / 16.

        • When set to a positive value, the image width is taken as a reference to force the height.
        • When set to a negative value, the image height is taken as a reference to force the width, and the ratio argument absolute value is taken.

        Specified by:
        setRatio in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Parameters:
        ratio - when set to 0, no ratio is applied
        See Also:
        SmartViewExtension.getRatio()

      • setMaxWidth

        public final void setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        Sets the widget maximum width. Defaults to Integer#MAX_VALUE. A #requestLayout() is required for the new value to take effect.
        Specified by:
        setMaxWidth in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - the new widget maximum width
        See Also:
        SmartViewExtension.setMaxHeight(int)

      • setMaxHeight

        public final void setMaxHeight(int maxHeight)
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        Sets the widget maximum height. Defaults to Integer#MAX_VALUE. A #requestLayout() is required for the new value to take effect.
        Specified by:
        setMaxHeight in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Parameters:
        maxHeight - the new widget maximum height
        See Also:
        SmartViewExtension.setMaxWidth(int)

      • getOnSizeChangedListener

        public final OnSizeChangedListener<SmartLinearLayout> getOnSizeChangedListener()
        Specified by:
        getOnSizeChangedListener in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Returns:
        the currently registered interface which listens for the widget size changes events ; is null by default

      • setOnSizeChangedListener

        public final void setOnSizeChangedListener(OnSizeChangedListener<SmartLinearLayout> onSizeChangedListener)
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        Sets the interface that will be invoked when the widget size changes.
        Specified by:
        setOnSizeChangedListener in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Parameters:
        onSizeChangedListener - may be null, and in that case, no interface will be notified

      • isRequestLayoutDisabled

        public final boolean isRequestLayoutDisabled()
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        The default value of the underlying flag is false.
        Specified by:
        isRequestLayoutDisabled in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Returns:
        true if and only if the #requestLayout() method execution should do nothing
        See Also:
        #setRequestLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • setRequestLayoutDisabled

        public final void setRequestLayoutDisabled(boolean requestLayoutDisabled)
        Description copied from interface: SmartViewExtension
        Indicates that the view #requestLayout() method execution should do nothing (not invoking the parent method).

        This feature is especially useful used in combination with the Gallery widget, which causes flickering issues when updating the widgets inside a ViewGroup.

        Specified by:
        setRequestLayoutDisabled in interface SmartViewExtension<SmartLinearLayout>
        Parameters:
        requestLayoutDisabled - when set to true, the #requestLayout() will not invoke its parent method, and hence will do nothing
